questions.questionText: What is the capital city of Japan?
questions.explanation: Tokyo has been the official capital of Japan since 1868. Kyoto was a former imperial capital. Beijing is the capital of China, and Seoul is the capital of South Korea.

questions.questionText: Which famous mountain is a widely recognized symbol of Japan?
questions.explanation: Mount Fuji is the highest peak in Japan and a revered symbol of the country. Mount Everest is in Nepal/China, Mount Kilimanjaro is in Tanzania (Africa), and Mount Kilauea is a volcano in Hawaii (USA).

questions.questionText: What is the name of the beautiful pink and white flowers that are a significant cultural symbol of Japan, especially in spring?
questions.explanation: Cherry blossoms, or Sakura, are an iconic symbol of Japan, celebrated for their ephemeral beauty in spring. Roses, tulips, and sunflowers are not primarily associated with Japanese culture in the same way.
